intro: Elatostema monandrum f. ciliatum, commonly known as the hairy elatostema, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces tiny greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically found in moist, shaded environments. It is native to parts of Asia, including regions of India and China, where it thrives in humid conditions. Due to its unique foliage and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
